msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuits Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

org.placeName: Ninth Judicial Circuit. Western District of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: Before P.V. Davis, Justic of the Peace in and for King County, residing and sitting in Seattle Precinct
State of Washington. County of King. ss.

K. McKay, being first duly sworn, on oath says: That at Seattle in said King County, State of Washington, on the 31st day of December, A.D. 1905, Joseph Walton did commit the crime of Barbering on Sunday as follows:

Then and there being the said Joseph Walton, in the County of King, State of Washington, on the 31st day of December, A.D. 1905, the said day being the first day of the week, commonly known as Sunday, did then and there wilfully and unlawfully carry on the business of barbering, contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the State of Washington.
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 2nd day of January, 1906. P. V. Davis. Justic of the Peace, Seattle Precintct, King County, Washington
